info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:14PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Missoula, northwestern Granite and northeastern Ravalli Counties through 300 PM MDT... At 214 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lolo, or 8 miles southwest of Missoula, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. Heavy rain is also likely with this storm. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Lolo, Clinton and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 113 and 123. Highway 93 S between mile markers 77 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
